org.knime.core.data.sort

Class AbstractTableSorter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.knime.core.data.sort.AbstractTableSorter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BufferedDataTableSorter, DataTableSorter

    abstract class AbstractTableSorter
extends Object
    Class to sort a table. See package description for details.
    Author:
    Bernd Wiswedel, KNIME.com, Zurich, Switzerland

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      The maximum number of open containers.
      static DataColumnSpec ROWKEY_SORT_SPEC
      Representing column spec to sort according to the row key.

      • AbstractTableSorter

        @Deprecated
public AbstractTableSorter(DataTable inputTable,
                                       int rowsCount,
                                       Collection<String> inclList,
                                       boolean[] sortAscending)
        Deprecated. use AbstractTableSorter(DataTable, long, Collection, boolean[]) instead which supports more than Integer.MAX_VALUE rows
        Inits table sorter using the sorting according to setSortColumns(Collection, boolean[]).
        Parameters:
        inputTable - The table to sort
        rowsCount - The number of rows in the table
        inclList - Passed on to setSortColumns(Collection, boolean[]).
        sortAscending - Passed on to setSortColumns(Collection, boolean[]).
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If any argument is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - If arguments are inconsistent.

      • AbstractTableSorter

        public AbstractTableSorter(DataTable inputTable,
                           long rowsCount,
                           Collection<String> inclList,
                           boolean[] sortAscending,
                           boolean sortMissingsToEnd)
        Inits table sorter using the sorting according to setSortColumns(Collection, boolean[], boolean).
        Parameters:
        inputTable - The table to sort
        rowsCount - The number of rows in the table
        inclList - Passed on to setSortColumns(Collection, boolean[], boolean).
        sortAscending - Passed on to setSortColumns(Collection, boolean[], boolean).
        sortMissingsToEnd - Passed on to setSortColumns(Collection, boolean[], boolean).
        Throws:

        IllegalArgumentException - If arguments are inconsistent.
        Since:
        2.6

    • Method Detail

      • setRowComparator

        public void setRowComparator(Comparator<DataRow> rowComparator)
        Parameters:
        rowComparator - the rowComparator to set

      • setSortColumns

        public void setSortColumns(Collection<String> inclList,
                           boolean[] sortAscending)
        Sets sorting columns and order.
        Parameters:
        inclList - the list with the columns to sort; the first column name represents the first sort criteria, the second the second criteria and so on.
        sortAscending - the sort order; each field corresponds to the column in the list of included columns. true: ascending false: descending

      • setSortColumns

        public void setSortColumns(Collection<String> inclList,
                           boolean[] sortAscending,
                           boolean sortMissingsToEnd)
        Sets sorting columns and order.
        Parameters:
        inclList - the list with the columns to sort; the first column name represents the first sort criteria, the second the second criteria and so on.
        sortAscending - the sort order; each field corresponds to the column in the list of included columns. true: ascending false: descending
        sortMissingsToEnd - Whether to sort missing values always to the end independent to the sort oder (if false missing values are always smaller than non-missings).
        Since:
        2.6

      • getMaxOpenContainers

        public int getMaxOpenContainers()
        Get the number of maximum open containers. See setMaxOpenContainers(int) for details.
        Returns:
        the maxOpenContainers

      • setMaxOpenContainers

        public void setMaxOpenContainers(int value)
        Changes the number of maximum open containers (=files) during the sorting. Containers are used in the k-way merge sort, the higher the number the fewer iterations in the final merge need to be done.

        The default is 40.

        Parameters:
        value - the maxOpenContainers to number of maximal open containers.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If argument is smaller or equal to 2.

      • setMaxRows

        void setMaxRows(int maxRows)
        Set the maximum number of rows per chunk, defaults to Integer.MAX_VALUE. This field is modified from the testing framework.
        Parameters:
        maxRows - the maxRows to set

      • setMemService

        void setMemService(MemoryAlertSystem memService)
        Set memory service. Used in unit test.
        Parameters:
        memService - the memService to set

      • getSortInMemory

        public boolean getSortInMemory()
        Returns:
        the sortInMemory field, see setSortInMemory(boolean) for details.

      • setSortInMemory

        public void setSortInMemory(boolean sortInMemory)
        Forces the sorting to happen in memory (if argument is true). This is not advisable as tables can be large. Note, the sorting may also take place in memory if the table is small (see class description for details).

        This option is merely to ensure backward compatibility and should not be used anymore.

        The default value for this option is false.

        Parameters:
        sortInMemory - true if sorting should be done in memory, false if sorting should be done in a hybrid way as described in the class description.

      • sortInternal

        DataTable sortInternal(ExecutionMonitor exec)
                throws CanceledExecutionException
        Sorts the table passed in the constructor according to the settings and returns the sorted output table.
        Parameters:
        exec - To report progress
        Returns:
        The sorted output.
        Throws:
        CanceledExecutionException - If canceled.

      • createDataContainer

        abstract DataContainer createDataContainer(DataTableSpec spec,
                                           boolean forceOnDisk)
        Creates data container, either a buffered data container or a plain one.
        Parameters:
        spec - The spec of the container/table.
        forceOnDisk - false to use default, true to flush data immediately to disk. It's true when used in the #sortOnDisk(ExecutionMonitor) method and the container is only used temporarily.
        Returns:
        A new fresh container.

      • clearTable

        abstract void clearTable(DataTable table)
        Clears the temporary table that was used during the execution but is no longer needed.
        Parameters:
        table - The table to be cleared.

      • mergeChunks

        Iterator<DataRow> mergeChunks(ExecutionMonitor exec,
                              boolean mergeCompletely)
                       throws CanceledExecutionException
        Parameters:
        exec - execution context
        mergeCompletely - if true the chunks are merged until only one chunk is left, otherwise the algorithm returns after at most m_maxOpenContainers chunks are used
        Returns:
        an iterator returning the sorted, merged result
        Throws:
        CanceledExecutionException - if the algorithm has been canceled

      • openChunk

        void openChunk()
        Opens a chunk data container to accept rows using addRowToChunk(DataRow), closeChunk() closes the current container and adds it to the chunk list.

      • addRowToChunk

        void addRowToChunk(DataRow dataRow)
        Adds a row to the current chunk.
        Parameters:
        dataRow - the row

      • closeChunk

        void closeChunk()
        Closes the chunk.
